remarks: If cyclically shifting a word of length being a prime number results in the word itself, the shift must be either by 0 (modulo the length of the word) or the word must be a "repeated symbol word".  (Contributed by AV, 18-May-2018.)  (Revised by AV, 10-Nov-2018.)
statement: cshwsidrepswmod0 $p |- ( ( W e. Word V /\ ( # ` W ) e. Prime /\ L e. ZZ ) -> ( ( W cyclShift L ) = W -> ( ( L mod ( # ` W ) ) = 0 \/ W = ( ( W ` 0 ) repeatS ( # ` W ) ) ) ) ) $.
